intro: Gagea succedanea, commonly known as the common gagea, is a flowering plant belonging to the Amaryllidaceae family. It is a bulbous perennial that typically grows in woodland and meadow habitats. The plant produces a single, upright stem bearing a cluster of bell-shaped, white or pale pink flowers. Its leaves are grass-like and form a basal rosette, and the bulbs are small and rounded. Gagea succedanea is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it is often found in temperate climates.
